results.title: Daisies = Sedmikrasky [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Filmove Studio Barrandov, Ceskoslovensky Filmexport, Bohumil Smida, Ladislav Fikar and Vera Chytilova
results.brief_description: A modern fable in a stylised setting; the void within the two interchangeable heroines, Marie I and II, bursts forth as a destructive impulse, directed at an indifferent world, in the form of a series of happenings built around particular themes (death, consumption, acting, destruction of meaning). The apparent stylisation in performance, cinematography, sets and music is best understood as subversive of “socialist realism” which, prior to the “New Wave”, had been obligatory in post-war Czech (and East European) cinema. The film was banned for a year and condemned as Dadaist and Brechtian, “at absolute variance with the Marxist-Leninist mission in the arts” as an “official” critic put it. In Czech with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Filmove Studio Barrandov, Ceskoslovensky Filmexport, Bohumil Smida, Ladislav Fikar and Vera Chytilova

The film was banned for a year and condemned as Dadaist and Brechtian, “at absolute variance with the Marxist-Leninist mission in the arts” as an “official” critic put it. In Czech with English subtitles.

results.title: Dairying: space and system
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, James Coffey, Meg Stewart and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Geography”.
Questioning the viability of marginal dairy farming this film examines the various factors involved in assessing this industry as a spatial system. It argues the importance of the relationship of the dairy farm with the wider community at different levels, suggests changes which might benefit the industry and community as a whole and finally it asks how long marginal dairy farming can survive.

results.brief_description: Shows scenes of milking, grazing of herds, production of hay, use of silage, production of small crops for farm use, fertilizing of pastures, pasteurization, cheese and butter making and export of dairy products.

results.title: Dairying in Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the work of a typical Victorian dairy farm throughout the year, the bulk handling and processing, distribution and export of dairy products. Filmed on locations at Hunterfield Jersey Stud, Kiewa Milk Supply and Murray Valley Irrigation. Commentary by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Daintree: The Vanishing Rainforest (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Richardson, Danae Gunn and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
A child returns from the future, a time when forests no longer exist and we see the rainforest and its most unusual inhabitants through her eyes. She grows to love the forest and cannot understand some of the things she sees happening. An imaginative and fascinating story which emphasises the delicate balance of nature, and how easily it can be destroyed.

results.title: Daintree: The Vanishing Rainforest
results.creator_credit: John Richardson, Danae Gunn and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
This video is Part 5 in a series of 6 documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia. A child returns from the future, a time when forests no longer exist and we see the rainforest and its most unusual inhabitants through her eyes. She grows to love the forest and cannot understand some of the things she sees happening. This is an imaginative and fascinating story which emphasises the delicate balance of nature, and how easily it can be destroyed. A Teacher’s guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Daily miracle
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows how the newspaper “The West Australian” is set up and printed. The film shows all stages of production, from setting of type which is then checked in the reading room to the final printing on rolls which contain over 120 miles of newsprint. Demonstrates how a big newspaper works, and its reliance on other world sources of news.
